author: Paul Rankin
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Place the flour, sugar, peanut butter, egg yolk and butter into a large bowl and mix together until combined to a smooth dough.  With lightly floured hands, break off evenly sized pieces of the dough and roll into walnut sized balls.  Place the dough balls onto a baking sheet lined with silicon paper or baking parchment and gently press each ball with the back of a fork to flatten slightly.  Place in the oven and bake for ten minutes, or until just turning golden-brown.  Transfer the cookies to a wire rack and allow to cool for ten minutes.  To serve, place on a serving plate and dust with icing sugar.
